duties_responsibilities.duty: Apply technical skills to evaluate options and design safe, cost-effective, and reliable facilities for residential, commercial, and industrial projects.
Demonstrate the ability to properly apply various codes, requirements, regulations, policies, and procedures to all assigned work.
Develop skills to safely make job-site visits and interact with construction personnel.
Prepare project and job packages that include material lists, requisitions, labor estimates, site drawings, and construction drawings for various installations of electrical facilities.
Develop skills to accurately evaluate loading on distribution equipment such as transformers & fusing.
Learn utility construction practices on public right of way (ROW) and private land.
Communicate job status to assure client expectations and deliverable dates are met.
Develop relationships with key internal and external customers while supporting both company and client's business goals and expectations.
Maintain files and records in an organized manner.
Mentor under experienced personnel, supervision, management, and PE.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field (Master's preferred)
